summary: The Middle Ages in Europe lasted from around 500 to 1500 AD. It's divided into three parts: Early, High, and Late Middle Ages. After the fall of the Western Roman Empire, there was a population decline and many changes. By the High Middle Ages, the population grew due to better farming, and towns developed. The power of the Catholic Church grew, and there were new ways of thinking, like scholasticism. The Late Middle Ages saw disasters like famine and the Black Death. This time also had big wars and the rise of new powers like the Ottoman Empire.
title: Middle Ages
